availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Anthony Webster (Green County, Kentucky, physician.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, physician. Virginia native. Son of Archibald Webster and Nancy Ellison Elmore Webster. Married to Mary Ann Brummal Webster in 1840. Father of Sarah L. Webster, Elizabeth E. Webster, Thomas A. Webster, and Francis E. Webster. Physician in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned Jo [Unknown], Sr., and Jo [Unknown], Jr., in 1849. Owned two enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Physician in Green County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Green County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 119A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Greensburg, p. 628.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Greensburg, p. 77B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Greensburg, p. 432A.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Taylor County Wills, vol. 1-2, 1848-1924, p. 16.
Lineage Book: National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution, vol. CV (Washington, D.C.: Judd & Detweiler, 1929), 62.
"Dr Thomas A Webster (1819-1886)," Find A Grave, Memorial 73272755, accessed March 3, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/73272755.
